articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Coronavirus fatalities: World Health Organization figures disputed
articles.description: New concerns about the coronavirus after the number of cases worldwide tops 100,000.
articles.content:
The World Health Organization says only 3.4 per cent of the total number of people who contracted the virus have died from it.
But this figure is being disputed.
Some health experts believe the number would be much lower if more people were tested.
Al Jaze… [+161 chars]

articles.author: Michele Bertelli
articles.title: Coronavirus wreaks havoc in Italy, tests limits of health system
articles.description: Nearly 6,000 test positive for novel coronavirus as the southern European nation struggles to contain outbreak.
articles.content:
Rome, Italy - Thirty-six coronavirus patients have died in Italy over the past 24 hours, bringing the total number of deaths to 233, the country's Civil Protection Agency has said.
Italy has struggled to contain the novel virus since February 20, when the so… [+6848 chars]

articles.title: Can we stop the panic over coronavirus?
articles.description: Fear and anxiety spreads as the number of cases rise around the world.

articles.author: Ted Regencia
articles.title: Coronavirus cases surpass 100,000 globally: Live updates
articles.description: At least 15 deaths and 164 infections reported in the US as Vice President Pence reports cases on board cruise ship.
articles.content: US Vice President Mike Pence announced on Friday that 21 people have tested positive of coronavirus on board the cruise ship, Grand Princess, stranded off the coast of California, as the outbreak continues to spread, infecting more than 100,000 people globall… [+3039 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Bethlehem under lockdown after coronavirus cases confirmed
articles.description: Palestinian officials announce state of emergency as number of infections rises to 16.
articles.content:
The city of Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank has been placed in lockdown after the first Palestinian cases of the new coronavirus were discovered there and authorities announced a state of emergency.
Palestinian Health Minister Mai al-Kaila said on Friday… [+3315 chars]

articles.author: Erin Hale
articles.title: Taiwan reins in spread of coronavirus as other countries stumble
articles.description: Experts say 'hard and bitter' lessons in dealing with SARS helped Taiwan quickly respond to deadly coronavirus outbreak.
articles.content: Taipei, Taiwan - With some 850,000 Taiwanese living and working in China, Taiwan could have been one of the hardest hit when the coronavirus outbreak emerged in late December in Wuhan, a central Chinese city of 11 million people and the epicentre of the outbr… [+8737 chars]

articles.title: Who will save the world from a coronavirus recession?
articles.description: Why a shock US central bank rate cut may not be enough to save the global economy from the coronavirus outbreak.

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Coronavirus control efforts linked to better China air quality
articles.description: Outbreak forces closure of coal-fired power plants and industrial facilities, leading to a drop in pollution.
articles.content:
Scientists believe a recent reduction in air pollution across much of China appears to be linked to the county's efforts to control the spread of the new coronavirus.

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Countries worst hit by coronavirus boost battle against epidemic
articles.description: South Korea and China intensify measures in a bid to stem the virus.
articles.content:
The worst-hit countries continue to intensify their efforts to contain the new coronavirus.
In South Korea, the sale of masks is being restricted to two a week per person.
It has more than 7,000 coronavirus cases - the most outside of China.
